definition: to fall off or jump off a building
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]

sentences.english: Their son had died after falling from a building, they were told.
sentences.chinese: 他们的儿子坠楼死亡了，他们被告知。

sentences.english: Case also attracted a large number of public falls curious onlookers.
sentences.chinese: 坠楼案也引来大批公众好奇的围观。

sentences.english: Twelve falls in Foxconn this year banged shocks on the international society.
sentences.chinese: 富士康今年发生十二起坠楼事件，震惊了国际社会。

sentences.english: A holidaymaker died after falling from a hotel balcony.
sentences.chinese: 一位观光客从饭店的阳台坠楼身亡。

definition: to jump from a building (to kill oneself)/fig. to sell at a large discount (in advertising)
to send or deliver to the hospital
to drown oneself by jumping into the river
to lose one's footing/to slip/to take a wrong step in life
to injure oneself in a fall
to fall into water/to sink/overboard/fig. to degenerate/to sink (into depravity)/to go to the dogs
to sound an alarm/to report sth to the police
